00190 // null pointer safety
00191 //
00192 #define CHK_LOG(title,comment) printf ("%s function: %s comment: %s", title, __func__, comment);
00193 // do not use cout; else will introduce GLIBCXX_3.4.9 dependency with 'g++ -O2'
00194 //#define CHK_LOG(title,comment) cout << title << " function: " << __func__ << " comment: " << comment << endl;
00195 //
00196 #define CHK_NUL_RET_RET(reference,comment) if ((reference) == NULL) \
00197         { CHK_LOG("CHK_NUL_RET_RET;",comment); return; }
00198 //
00199 #define CHK_NUL_RET_NUL(reference,comment) if ((reference) == NULL) \
00200         { CHK_LOG("CHK_NUL_RET_NUL;",comment); return NULL; }
00201 //
00202 #define CHK_NUL_RET_FLS(reference,comment) if ((reference) == NULL) \
00203         { CHK_LOG("CHK_NUL_RET_FLS;",comment); return false; }
00204 //
00205 #define CHK_NUL_RET_ERR(reference,comment) if ((reference) == NULL) \
00206         { CHK_LOG("CHK_NUL_RET_ERR;",comment); return JNI_ERR; }
00207 //
00208 // c++ <-> java, bool <-> boolean conversions
00209 #define BOOL(x) (((x) == JNI_TRUE) ? true : false) // from java to c++
00210 #define BOOLEAN(x) ((jboolean) ( ((x) == true) ? JNI_TRUE : JNI_FALSE )) // from c++ to java
00211 //
00212 // free/malloc convenience
00213 #define FREE(x) if ((x) != NULL) { free(x); x = NULL; }
00214 #define MALLOC(var,type,size) type* var = (type*) malloc(sizeof(type) * size);

00216 void X_InitClassReference(JNIEnv *env, jclass *classReference,
00217                 const char *className) {
00218         CHK_NUL_RET_RET(env, "env");
00219         CHK_NUL_RET_RET(className, "className");
00220         CHK_NUL_RET_RET(classReference,"classReference");
00221         jclass klaz = env->FindClass(className);
00222         CHK_NUL_RET_RET(klaz, "klaz");
00223         *classReference = static_cast<jclass> (env->NewGlobalRef((jobject) klaz));
00224         CHK_NUL_RET_RET(*classReference, "*classReference");
00225 }

00245 // NOTE: ipv4 only
00246 int X_InitSockAddr(sockaddr* sockAddr) {
00247         CHK_NUL_RET_ERR(sockAddr, "sockAddr");
00248         sockaddr_in* sockAddrIn = (sockaddr_in*) sockAddr;
00249         sockAddrIn->sin_family = AF_INET;
00250         memset(&(sockAddrIn->sin_zero), '\0', 8);
00251         return JNI_OK;
00252 }

00254 inline bool X_IsInRange(jlong min, jlong var, jlong max) {
00255         if (min <= var && var <= max) {
00256                 return true;
00257         } else {
00258                 return false;
00259         }
00260 }
00261 
00262 inline void X_ConvertMillisIntoTimeValue(const jlong millisTimeout,
00263                 timeval* timeValue) {
00264         if (millisTimeout < 0) { // infinite wait
00265                 timeValue->tv_sec = INT_MAX;
00266                 timeValue->tv_usec = 0;
00267         } else if (millisTimeout > 0) { // finite wait
00268                 timeValue->tv_sec = millisTimeout / 1000; // msvc C4244
00269                 timeValue->tv_usec = (millisTimeout % 1000) * 1000;
00270         } else { // immediate return (not less the UDT event slice of 10 ms)
00271                 timeValue->tv_sec = 0;
00272                 timeValue->tv_usec = 0;
00273         }
00274 }

00276 // NOTE: ipv4 only
00277 int X_ConvertInetSocketAddressToSockaddr(JNIEnv* env,
00278                 jobject objInetSocketAddress, sockaddr* sockAddr) {
00279 
00280         CHK_NUL_RET_ERR(env,"env");
00281         CHK_NUL_RET_ERR(sockAddr,"sockAddr");
00282         CHK_NUL_RET_ERR(objInetSocketAddress,"objInetSocketAddress");
00283 
00284         jobject objInetAddress = env->GetObjectField(objInetSocketAddress,
00285                         isa_InetAddressID);
00286         CHK_NUL_RET_ERR(objInetAddress,"objInetAddress");
00287 
00288         jint address = env->GetIntField(objInetAddress, ia_AddressID);
00289         jint port = env->GetIntField(objInetSocketAddress, isa_PortID);
00290 
00291         sockaddr_in* sockAddrIn = (sockaddr_in*) sockAddr;
00292 
00293         sockAddrIn->sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(address);
00294         sockAddrIn->sin_port = htons(port); // msvc C4244
00295 
00296         return JNI_OK;
00297 
00298 }

00300 // NOTE: ipv4 only
00301 int X_ConvertSockaddrToInetSocketAddress(JNIEnv* env, sockaddr* sockAddr,
00302                 jobject objInetSocketAddress) {
00303 
00304         CHK_NUL_RET_ERR(env, "env");
00305         CHK_NUL_RET_ERR(sockAddr,"sockAddr");
00306         CHK_NUL_RET_ERR(objInetSocketAddress,"objInetSocketAddress");
00307 
00308         jobject objInetAddress = env->GetObjectField(objInetSocketAddress,
00309                         isa_InetAddressID);
00310         CHK_NUL_RET_ERR(objInetAddress,"objInetAddress");
00311 
00312         sockaddr_in* sockAddrIn = (sockaddr_in*) sockAddr;
00313 
00314         jint address = ntohl(sockAddrIn->sin_addr.s_addr);
00315         jint port = ntohs(sockAddrIn->sin_port);
00316 
00317         env->SetIntField(objInetAddress, ia_AddressID, address);
00318         env->SetIntField(objInetSocketAddress, isa_PortID, port);
00319 
00320         return JNI_OK;
00321 
00322 }

00341 // NOTE: ipv4 only
00342 jobject X_NewInetSocketAddress(JNIEnv* env, sockaddr* sockAddr) {
00343 
00344         CHK_NUL_RET_NUL(env,"env");
00345         CHK_NUL_RET_NUL(sockAddr,"sockAddr");
00346 
00347         sockaddr_in* sockAddrIn = (sockaddr_in*) sockAddr;
00348         jint address = ntohl(sockAddrIn->sin_addr.s_addr);
00349         jint port = ntohs(sockAddrIn->sin_port);
00350 
00351         jobject objInetAddress = X_NewInetAddress(env, address);
00352         CHK_NUL_RET_NUL(objInetAddress,"objInetAddress");
00353 
00354         jobject objInetSocketAddress = env->NewObject(jdk_clsInetSocketAddress,
00355                         jdk_clsInetSocketAddress_initID, objInetAddress, port);
00356 
00357         CHK_NUL_RET_NUL(objInetSocketAddress,"objInetSocketAddress");
00358 
00359         return objInetSocketAddress;
00360 
00361 }

00363 bool X_IsSockaddrEqualsInetSocketAddress(JNIEnv* env, sockaddr* sockAddr,
00364                 jobject socketAddress) {
00365 
00366         CHK_NUL_RET_FLS(env,"env");
00367         CHK_NUL_RET_FLS(sockAddr,"sockAddr");
00368         CHK_NUL_RET_FLS(socketAddress,"socketAddress");
00369 
00370         sockaddr_in* sockAddrIn = (sockaddr_in*) sockAddr;
00371 
00372         jint address1 = ntohl(sockAddrIn->sin_addr.s_addr);
00373         jint port1 = ntohs(sockAddrIn->sin_port);
00374 
00375         jobject objInetAddress = env->GetObjectField(socketAddress,
00376                         isa_InetAddressID);
00377 
00378         CHK_NUL_RET_FLS(objInetAddress,"objInetAddress");
00379 
00380         jint address2 = env->GetIntField(objInetAddress, ia_AddressID);
00381         jint port2 = env->GetIntField(socketAddress, isa_PortID);
00382 
00383         if (address1 == address2 && port1 == port2) {
00384                 return true;
00385         }
00386 
00387         return false;
00388 
00389 }

00401 // custom class for struct linger conversion
00402 jobject UDT_NewLingerUDT(JNIEnv* env, linger* lingerValue) {
00403         CHK_NUL_RET_NUL(env,"env");
00404         CHK_NUL_RET_NUL(lingerValue,"lingerValue");
00405         int value;
00406         if (lingerValue->l_onoff == 0) {
00407                 value = 0;
00408         } else {
00409                 value = lingerValue->l_linger;
00410         }
00411         jobject objLinger = env->NewObject(udt_clsLingerUDT,
00412                         udt_clsLingerUDT_initID, (jint) value);
00413         CHK_NUL_RET_NUL(objLinger,"objLinger");
00414         return objLinger;
00415 }

00417 // java wrapper exception error codes; keep in sync with ErrorUDT.java
00418 #define UDT_WRAPPER_UNKNOWN -1 // WRAPPER_UNKNOWN(-1, "unknown error code"), //
00419 #define UDT_WRAPPER_UNIMPLEMENTED -2 // WRAPPER_UNIMPLEMENTED(-2, "this feature is not yet implemented"), //
00420 #define UDT_WRAPPER_MESSAGE -3 // WRAPPER_MESSAGE(-3, "wrapper generated error"), //
00421 #define UDT_USER_DEFINED_MESSAGE -4 // USER_DEFINED_MESSAGE(-4, "user defined message"), //
00422 //
00423 
00424 // NOTE: socket id stored in java object SocketUDT
00425 //
00426 jint UDT_GetSocketID(JNIEnv* env, jobject self) {
00427         return env->GetIntField(self, udts_SocketID);
00428 }
00429 //
00430 void UDT_SetSocketID(JNIEnv* env, jobject self, jint socketID) {
00431         env->SetIntField(self, udts_SocketID, socketID);
00432 }

00434 jthrowable UDT_NewExceptionUDT(JNIEnv* env, const jint socketID,
00435                 jint errorCode, const char* message) {
00436         CHK_NUL_RET_NUL(env,"env");
00437         jstring messageString = env->NewStringUTF(message);
00438         CHK_NUL_RET_NUL(messageString,"messageString");
00439         jobject exception = env->NewObject(udt_clsExceptionUDT,
00440                         udt_clsExceptionUDT_initID0, socketID, errorCode, messageString);
00441         return static_cast<jthrowable> (exception);
00442 }
00443 
00444 void UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_Message(JNIEnv* env, const jint socketID,
00445                 const char *comment) {
00446         CHK_NUL_RET_RET(env,"env");
00447         CHK_NUL_RET_RET(comment,"comment");
00448         jint code = UDT_WRAPPER_MESSAGE;
00449         jthrowable exception = UDT_NewExceptionUDT(env, socketID, code, comment);
00450         CHK_NUL_RET_RET(exception,"exception");
00451         env->Throw(exception);
00452 }

00454 // socketID == 0 means not applicable / not known id
00455 void UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_ErrorInfo(JNIEnv* env, const jint socketID,
00456                 const char* comment, UDT::ERRORINFO* errorInfo) {
00457         CHK_NUL_RET_RET(env,"env");
00458         CHK_NUL_RET_RET(comment,"comment");
00459         CHK_NUL_RET_RET(errorInfo,"errorInfo");
00460         jint code = errorInfo->getErrorCode();
00461         jthrowable exception = UDT_NewExceptionUDT(env, socketID, code, comment);
00462         CHK_NUL_RET_RET(exception,"exception");
00463         env->Throw(exception);
00464 }

00489         udtm_pktRecv = env->GetFieldID(cls, "pktRecv", "J"); // number of received packets

00513 void UDT_InitClassRefAll(JNIEnv* env) {
00514 
00515         // JDK
00516 
00517         X_InitClassReference(env, &jdk_clsBoolean, "java/lang/Boolean");
00518         X_InitClassReference(env, &jdk_clsInteger, "java/lang/Integer");
00519         X_InitClassReference(env, &jdk_clsLong, "java/lang/Long");
00520 
00521         X_InitClassReference(env, &jdk_clsInet4Address, "java/net/Inet4Address");
00522         X_InitClassReference(env, &jdk_clsInet6Address, "java/net/Inet6Address");
00523         X_InitClassReference(env, &jdk_clsInetSocketAddress,
00524                         "java/net/InetSocketAddress");
00525 
00526         X_InitClassReference(env, &jdk_clsSocketException,
00527                         "java/net/SocketException");
00528 
00529         X_InitClassReference(env, &jdk_clsSet, "java/util/Set");
00530         X_InitClassReference(env, &jdk_clsIterator, "java/util/Iterator");
00531 
00532         // UDT
00533 
00534         X_InitClassReference(env, &udt_clsSocketUDT, //
00535                         "com/barchart/udt/SocketUDT");
00536         X_InitClassReference(env, &udt_clsTypeUDT, //
00537                         "com/barchart/udt/TypeUDT");
00538         X_InitClassReference(env, &udt_clsFactoryUDT, //
00539                         "com/barchart/udt/FactoryUDT");
00540         X_InitClassReference(env, &udt_clsMonitorUDT, //
00541                         "com/barchart/udt/MonitorUDT");
00542         X_InitClassReference(env, &udt_clsExceptionUDT, //
00543                         "com/barchart/udt/ExceptionUDT");
00544         X_InitClassReference(env, &udt_clsLingerUDT, //
00545                         "com/barchart/udt/LingerUDT");
00546

00549 void UDT_InitFieldRefAll(JNIEnv* env) {
00550 
00551         // JDK
00552 
00553         ia_AddressID = env->GetFieldID(jdk_clsInet4Address, "address", "I");
00554         isa_InetAddressID = env->GetFieldID(jdk_clsInetSocketAddress, "addr",
00555                         "Ljava/net/InetAddress;");
00556         isa_PortID = env->GetFieldID(jdk_clsInetSocketAddress, "port", "I");
00557 
00558         // UDT SocketUDT
00559 
00560         udts_SocketID = env->GetFieldID(udt_clsSocketUDT, //
00561                         "socketID", "I");
00562         udts_RemoteSocketAddressID = env->GetFieldID(udt_clsSocketUDT, //
00563                         "remoteSocketAddress", "Ljava/net/InetSocketAddress;");
00564         udts_LocalSocketAddressID = env->GetFieldID(udt_clsSocketUDT, //
00565                         "localSocketAddress", "Ljava/net/InetSocketAddress;");
00566         udts_TypeID = env->GetFieldID(udt_clsSocketUDT, //
00567                         "type", "Lcom/barchart/udt/TypeUDT;");
00568         udts_MonitorID = env->GetFieldID(udt_clsSocketUDT, //
00569                         "monitor", "Lcom/barchart/udt/MonitorUDT;");
00570 
00571         udts_IsSelectedReadID = env->GetFieldID(udt_clsSocketUDT, //
00572                         "isSelectedRead", "Z");
00573         udts_IsSelectedWriteID = env->GetFieldID(udt_clsSocketUDT, //
00574                         "isSelectedWrite", "Z");
00575         udts_IsSelectedExceptionID = env->GetFieldID(udt_clsSocketUDT, //
00576                         "isSelectedException", "Z");
00577 
00578         // UDT TypeUDT
00579 
00580         udtt_TypeCodeID = env->GetFieldID(udt_clsTypeUDT, "code", "I");
00581 
00582         // UDT MonitorUDT
00583 
00584         UDT_InitFieldMonitor(env);
00585 
00586 }

00588 void X_InitMethodRef(JNIEnv* env, jmethodID *methodID, jclass klaz,
00589                 const char* name, const char* signature) {
00590 
00591         *methodID = env->GetMethodID(klaz, name, signature);
00592 
00593         CHK_NUL_RET_RET(*methodID, name);
00594 
00595 }

00674 // called on java class load
00675 JNIEXPORT void JNICALL Java_com_barchart_udt_SocketUDT_initClass0(JNIEnv* env,
00676                 jclass clsSocketUDT) {
00677 
00678         UNUSED(env);
00679         UNUSED(clsSocketUDT);
00680 
00681         //      printf("native: udt-initClass0\n");
00682 
00683         UDT_InitClassRefAll(env);
00684 
00685         UDT_InitFieldRefAll(env);
00686 
00687         UDT_InitMethodRefAll(env);
00688 
00689         const int rv = UDT::startup();
00690 
00691         if (rv == UDT::ERROR) {
00692                 UDT::ERRORINFO errorInfo = UDT::getlasterror();
00693                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_ErrorInfo(env, 0, "initClass0:startup()",
00694                                 &errorInfo);
00695                 return;
00696         }
00697 
00698 }

00720 // used by default constructor
00721 JNIEXPORT jint JNICALL Java_com_barchart_udt_SocketUDT_initInstance0(
00722                 JNIEnv* env, jobject self, jint typeCode) {
00723 
00724         //      printf("native: udt-initInstance0\n");
00725 
00726         int socketAddressFamily = AF_INET;
00727         int socketType = typeCode;
00728 
00729         //      printf("native: init instance; type=%d\n", type);
00730 
00731         const jint socketID = UDT::socket(socketAddressFamily, socketType, 0);
00732 
00733         // change private final field
00734         UDT_SetSocketID(env, self, socketID);
00735 
00736         if (socketID == UDT::INVALID_SOCK) {
00737                 UDT::ERRORINFO errorInfo = UDT::getlasterror();
00738                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_ErrorInfo(env, socketID,
00739                                 "initInstance0:INVALID_SOCK", &errorInfo);
00740                 return JNI_ERR;
00741         }
00742 
00743         return socketID;
00744 
00745 }

00765 
00766 JNIEXPORT jobject JNICALL Java_com_barchart_udt_SocketUDT_accept0(JNIEnv* env,
00767                 jobject self) {
00768 
00769         //      printf("native : accept\n");
00770 
00771         sockaddr remoteSockAddr;
00772         int remoteSockAddrSize = sizeof(remoteSockAddr);
00773 
00774         const jint socketID = UDT_GetSocketID(env, self);
00775 
00776         const jint socketACC = UDT::accept(socketID, &remoteSockAddr,
00777                         &remoteSockAddrSize);
00778 
00779         if (socketACC == UDT::INVALID_SOCK) {
00780 
00781                 UDT::ERRORINFO errorInfo = UDT::getlasterror();
00782 
00783                 const jint errorCode = errorInfo.getErrorCode();
00784 
00785                 if (errorCode == CUDTException::EASYNCRCV) {
00786                         // not a java exception: non-blocking mode return, when not connections in the queue
00787                 } else {
00788                         // really exception
00789                         UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_ErrorInfo(env, socketID,
00790                                         "accept:INVALID_SOCK", &errorInfo);
00791                 }
00792 
00793                 return NULL;
00794 
00795         }
00796 
00797         jobject objTypeUDT = env->GetObjectField(self, udts_TypeID);
00798 
00799         CHK_NUL_RET_NUL(objTypeUDT,"objTypeUDT");
00800 
00801         jobject objSocketUDT = env->NewObject(udt_clsSocketUDT,
00802                         udt_clsSocketUDT_initID1, objTypeUDT, socketACC);
00803 
00804         CHK_NUL_RET_NUL(objSocketUDT, "objSocketUDT");
00805 
00806         return objSocketUDT;
00807 
00808 }
00809 
00810 JNIEXPORT void JNICALL Java_com_barchart_udt_SocketUDT_bind0(JNIEnv* env,
00811                 jobject self, jobject objLocalSocketAddress) {
00812 
00813         const jint socketID = UDT_GetSocketID(env, self);
00814 
00815         int rv;
00816 
00817         sockaddr localSockAddr;
00818 
00819         rv = X_InitSockAddr(&localSockAddr);
00820 
00821         if (rv == JNI_ERR) {
00822                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_Message(env, socketID, "can not X_InitSockAddr");
00823                 return;
00824         }
00825 
00826         rv = X_ConvertInetSocketAddressToSockaddr(env, objLocalSocketAddress,
00827                         &localSockAddr);
00828 
00829         if (rv == JNI_ERR) {
00830                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_Message(env, socketID,
00831                                 "can not X_ConvertInetSocketAddressToSockaddr");
00832                 return;
00833         }
00834 
00835         rv = UDT::bind(socketID, &localSockAddr, sizeof(localSockAddr));
00836 
00837         if (rv == UDT::ERROR) {
00838                 UDT::ERRORINFO errorInfo = UDT::getlasterror();
00839                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_ErrorInfo(env, socketID, "bind0 failed",
00840                                 &errorInfo);
00841                 return;
00842         }
00843 
00844 }

00855                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_ErrorInfo(env, socketID, "close0 failed",
00856                                 &errorInfo);
00857                 return;
00858         }

00863 JNIEXPORT void JNICALL Java_com_barchart_udt_SocketUDT_connect0(JNIEnv* env,
00864                 jobject self, jobject objRemoteSocketAddress) {
00865 
00866         const jint socketID = UDT_GetSocketID(env, self);
00867 
00868         if (objRemoteSocketAddress == NULL) {
00869                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_Message(env, socketID,
00870                                 "objRemoteSocketAddress == NULL");
00871                 return;
00872         }
00873 
00874         int rv;
00875 
00876         sockaddr remoteSockAddr;
00877 
00878         rv = X_InitSockAddr(&remoteSockAddr);
00879 
00880         if (rv == JNI_ERR) {
00881                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_Message(env, socketID, "can not X_InitSockAddr");
00882                 return;
00883         }
00884 
00885         rv = X_ConvertInetSocketAddressToSockaddr(env, //
00886                         objRemoteSocketAddress, &remoteSockAddr);
00887 
00888         if (rv == JNI_ERR) {
00889                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_Message(env, socketID,
00890                                 "can not X_ConvertInetSocketAddressToSockaddr");
00891                 return;
00892         }
00893 
00894         rv = UDT::connect(socketID, &remoteSockAddr, sizeof(remoteSockAddr));
00895 
00896         if (rv == UDT::ERROR) {
00897                 UDT::ERRORINFO errorInfo = UDT::getlasterror();
00898                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_ErrorInfo(env, socketID, "connect0 failed",
00899                                 &errorInfo);
00900                 return;
00901         }
00902 
00903 }

00905 JNIEXPORT jboolean JNICALL Java_com_barchart_udt_SocketUDT_hasLoadedRemoteSocketAddress(
00906                 JNIEnv* env, jobject self) {
00907 
00908         //      printf("native: udt-hasLoadedRemoteSocketAddress\n");
00909 
00910         const jint socketID = UDT_GetSocketID(env, self);
00911 
00912         sockaddr remoteSockAddr;
00913         int remoteSockAddrSize = sizeof(remoteSockAddr);
00914 
00915         // "peer" means remote
00916         const int rv = UDT::getpeername(socketID, &remoteSockAddr,
00917                         &remoteSockAddrSize);
00918 
00919         if (rv == UDT::ERROR) {
00920                 // no exceptions
00921                 return JNI_FALSE;
00922         }
00923 
00924         jobject objRemoteSocketAddress = env->GetObjectField(self,
00925                         udts_RemoteSocketAddressID);
00926 
00927         if (objRemoteSocketAddress == NULL || !X_IsSockaddrEqualsInetSocketAddress(
00928                         env, &remoteSockAddr, objRemoteSocketAddress)) {
00929 
00930                 objRemoteSocketAddress = X_NewInetSocketAddress(env, &remoteSockAddr);
00931 
00932                 env->SetObjectField(self, udts_RemoteSocketAddressID,
00933                                 objRemoteSocketAddress);
00934 
00935         }
00936 
00937         return JNI_TRUE;
00938 
00939 }
00940 
00941 JNIEXPORT jboolean JNICALL Java_com_barchart_udt_SocketUDT_hasLoadedLocalSocketAddress(
00942                 JNIEnv* env, jobject self) {
00943 
00944         //      printf("native : hasLoadedLocalSocketAddress\n");
00945 
00946         const jint socketID = UDT_GetSocketID(env, self);
00947 
00948         sockaddr localSockAddr;
00949         int localSockAddrSize = sizeof(localSockAddr);
00950 
00951         // "sock" means local
00952         const int rv = UDT::getsockname(socketID, &localSockAddr,
00953                         &localSockAddrSize);
00954 
00955         if (rv == UDT::ERROR) {
00956                 // no exceptions
00957                 return JNI_FALSE;
00958         }
00959 
00960         jobject objLocalSocketAddress = env->GetObjectField(self,
00961                         udts_LocalSocketAddressID);
00962 
00963         if (objLocalSocketAddress == NULL || !X_IsSockaddrEqualsInetSocketAddress(
00964                         env, &localSockAddr, objLocalSocketAddress)) {
00965 
00966                 objLocalSocketAddress = X_NewInetSocketAddress(env, &localSockAddr);
00967 
00968                 env->SetObjectField(self, udts_LocalSocketAddressID,
00969                                 objLocalSocketAddress);
00970 
00971         }
00972 
00973         return JNI_TRUE;
00974 
00975 }
00976 
00977 // struct that fits all UDT options types
00978 union UDT_OptVal {
00979         void* factory;
00980         linger lingerValue;
00981         int64_t longValue;
00982         int intValue;
00983         bool boolValue;
00984 };
00985 
00986 JNIEXPORT jobject JNICALL Java_com_barchart_udt_SocketUDT_getOption0(
00987                 JNIEnv *env, jobject self, jint enumCode, jclass klaz) {
00988 
00989         //      printf("native : getSocketOption\n");
00990 
00991         UDT::SOCKOPT optionName = (UDT::SOCKOPT) enumCode;
00992         UDT_OptVal optionValue;
00993         int optionValueSize = sizeof(optionValue);
00994 
00995         const jint socketID = UDT_GetSocketID(env, self);
00996 
00997         const int rv = UDT::getsockopt(socketID, 0, optionName,
00998                         (void*) &optionValue, &optionValueSize);
00999 
01000         if (rv == UDT::ERROR) {
01001                 UDT::ERRORINFO errorInfo = UDT::getlasterror();
01002                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_ErrorInfo(env, socketID, "getsockopt", &errorInfo);
01003                 return NULL;
01004         }
01005 
01006         if (env->IsSameObject(klaz, jdk_clsBoolean)) {
01007                 //      printf("native: Boolean\n");
01008                 return X_NewBoolean(env, optionValue.boolValue);
01009         } else if (env->IsSameObject(klaz, jdk_clsInteger)) {
01010                 //      printf("native: Integer\n");
01011                 return X_NewInteger(env, optionValue.intValue);
01012         } else if (env->IsSameObject(klaz, udt_clsLingerUDT)) {
01013                 //      printf("native: Linger\n");
01014                 return UDT_NewLingerUDT(env, &(optionValue.lingerValue));
01015         } else if (env->IsSameObject(klaz, jdk_clsLong)) {
01016                 //      printf("native: Long\n");
01017                 return X_NewLong(env, optionValue.longValue);
01018         } else if (env->IsSameObject(klaz, udt_clsFactoryUDT)) {
01019                 //      printf("native: FactoryUDT\n");
01020                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_Message(env, socketID,
01021                                 "not yet implemented: FactoryUDT");
01022                 return NULL;
01023         } else {
01024                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_Message(env, socketID,
01025                                 "unsupported option class in OptionUDT");
01026                 return NULL;
01027         }
01028 
01029 }
01030 
01031 JNIEXPORT void JNICALL Java_com_barchart_udt_SocketUDT_setOption0(JNIEnv *env,
01032                 jobject self, jint enumCode, jclass klaz, jobject objValue) {
01033 
01034         //      printf("native : setSocketOption\n");
01035 
01036         const jint socketID = UDT_GetSocketID(env, self);
01037 
01038         UDT::SOCKOPT optionName = (UDT::SOCKOPT) enumCode;
01039         UDT_OptVal optionValue;
01040         int optionValueSize = sizeof(optionValue);
01041 
01042         if (env->IsSameObject(klaz, jdk_clsBoolean)) {
01043                 jmethodID methodID = env->GetMethodID(//
01044                                 jdk_clsBoolean, "booleanValue", "()Z");
01045                 jboolean value = env->CallBooleanMethod(objValue, methodID);
01046                 //              cout << "Boolean:" << BOOL(value) << "\n";
01047                 optionValue.boolValue = BOOL(value);
01048                 optionValueSize = sizeof(bool);
01049         } else if (env->IsSameObject(klaz, jdk_clsInteger)) {
01050                 jmethodID methodID = env->GetMethodID(jdk_clsInteger, //
01051                                 "intValue", "()I");
01052                 jint value = env->CallIntMethod(objValue, methodID);
01053                 //              cout << "Integer:" << value << "\n";
01054                 optionValue.intValue = value;
01055                 optionValueSize = sizeof(int);
01056         } else if (env->IsSameObject(klaz, udt_clsLingerUDT)) {
01057                 jmethodID methodID = env->GetMethodID(//
01058                                 udt_clsLingerUDT, "intValue", "()I");
01059                 int value = env->CallIntMethod(objValue, methodID);
01060                 //              cout << "Linger:" << value << EOL;
01061                 if (value <= 0) {
01062                         optionValue.lingerValue.l_onoff = 0;
01063                         optionValue.lingerValue.l_linger = 0;
01064                 } else {
01065                         optionValue.lingerValue.l_onoff = 1;
01066                         optionValue.lingerValue.l_linger = value; // msvc C4244
01067                 }
01068                 optionValueSize = sizeof(linger);
01069         } else if (env->IsSameObject(klaz, jdk_clsLong)) {
01070                 jmethodID methodID = env->GetMethodID(//
01071                                 jdk_clsLong, "longValue", "()J");
01072                 jlong value = env->CallLongMethod(objValue, methodID);
01073                 //              cout << "Long:" << value << "\n";
01074                 optionValue.longValue = value;
01075                 optionValueSize = sizeof(int64_t);
01076         } else if (env->IsSameObject(klaz, udt_clsFactoryUDT)) {
01077                 //              printf("FactoryUDT\n");
01078                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_Message(env, socketID,
01079                                 "not yet implemented: FactoryUDT");
01080                 return;
01081         } else {
01082                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_Message(env, socketID,
01083                                 "unsupported option class in OptionUDT");
01084                 return;
01085         }
01086 
01087         const int rv = UDT::setsockopt(socketID, 0, optionName,
01088                         (void*) &optionValue, optionValueSize);
01089 
01090         if (rv == UDT::ERROR) {
01091                 UDT::ERRORINFO errorInfo = UDT::getlasterror();
01092                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_ErrorInfo(env, socketID, "setOption0", &errorInfo);
01093                 return;
01094         }
01095 
01096 }
01097 
01098 JNIEXPORT void JNICALL Java_com_barchart_udt_SocketUDT_listen0(JNIEnv *env,
01099                 jobject self, jint queueSize) {
01100 
01101         // printf("native : listen\n");
01102 
01103         const jint socketID = UDT_GetSocketID(env, self);
01104 
01105         const int rv = UDT::listen(socketID, queueSize);
01106 
01107         if (rv == UDT::ERROR) {
01108                 UDT::ERRORINFO errorInfo = UDT::getlasterror();
01109                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_ErrorInfo(env, socketID, "listen0", &errorInfo);
01110                 return;
01111         }
01112 
01113 }
01114 
01115 // #########################################################################
01116 
01117 bool X_IsValidRange(JNIEnv *env, jint socketID, //
01118                 jlong position, jlong limit, jlong capacity) {
01119         if (!X_IsInRange(0, position, capacity)) {
01120                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_Message(env, socketID, "position is out of range");
01121                 return false;
01122         }
01123         if (!X_IsInRange(0, limit, capacity)) {
01124                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_Message(env, socketID, "limit is out of range");
01125                 return false;
01126         }
01127         if (position > limit) {
01128                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_Message(env, socketID, "position > limit");
01129                 return false;
01130         }
01131         return true;
01132 }
01133 
01134 // #######################################################################
01135 
01136 /*
01137  * receiveX call is shared for both receive() and receivemsg()
01138  */
01139 
01140 // return values, if exception is NOT thrown
01141 // -1 : nothing received (non-blocking only)
01142 // =0 : timeout expired (blocking only)
01143 // >0 : normal receive
01144 
01145 jint UDT_ReturnReceiveError(JNIEnv *env, const jint socketID) {
01146         UDT::ERRORINFO errorInfo = UDT::getlasterror();
01147         int errorCode = errorInfo.getErrorCode();
01148         if (errorCode == CUDTException::EASYNCRCV) {
01149                 // not a java exception: non-blocking mode return when nothing is received
01150         } else {
01151                 // really exception
01152                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_ErrorInfo(env, socketID, "recv/recvmsg",
01153                                 &errorInfo);
01154         }
01155         return JNI_ERR;
01156 }
01157 
01158 // receive into complete array
01159 JNIEXPORT jint JNICALL Java_com_barchart_udt_SocketUDT_receive0(JNIEnv *env,
01160                 jobject self, const jint socketID, const jint socketType,
01161                 jbyteArray arrayObj) {
01162 
01163         UNUSED(self);
01164 
01165         //      printf("native : receive0\n");
01166 
01167         jboolean isCopy; // whether JVM returns a reference or a copy
01168         jbyte* data = env->GetByteArrayElements(arrayObj, &isCopy); // note: must release
01169         const jsize size = env->GetArrayLength(arrayObj);
01170 
01171         int rv;
01172 
01173         switch (socketType) {
01174         case SOCK_STREAM:
01175                 // printf("native: udt-receive0; SOCK_STREAM; socketID=%d\n", socketID);
01176                 rv = UDT::recv(socketID, (char*) data, (int) size, 0);
01177                 break;
01178         case SOCK_DGRAM:
01179                 // printf("native: udt-receive0; SOCK_DGRAM; socketID=%d\n", socketID);
01180                 rv = UDT::recvmsg(socketID, (char*) data, (int) size);
01181                 break;
01182         default:
01183                 env->ReleaseByteArrayElements(arrayObj, data, JNI_ABORT); // do not copy back
01184                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_Message(env, socketID,
01185                                 "recv/recvmsg : unexpected socketType");
01186                 return JNI_ERR;
01187         }
01188 
01189         if (rv > 0) { // normal
01190                 env->ReleaseByteArrayElements(arrayObj, data, JNI_UPDATE); //
01191                 return rv;
01192         } else if (rv < 0) { // UDT::ERROR
01193                 env->ReleaseByteArrayElements(arrayObj, data, JNI_ABORT); //
01194                 return UDT_ReturnReceiveError(env, socketID);
01195         } else { // ==0; UDT_TIMEOUT
01196                 env->ReleaseByteArrayElements(arrayObj, data, JNI_ABORT); //
01197                 return UDT_TIMEOUT;
01198         }
01199 
01200 }
01201 
01202 // receive into a portion of an array
01203 JNIEXPORT jint JNICALL Java_com_barchart_udt_SocketUDT_receive1(JNIEnv *env,
01204                 jobject self, const jint socketID, const jint socketType,
01205                 jbyteArray arrayObj, const jint position, const jint limit) {
01206 
01207         UNUSED(self);
01208 
01209         //      printf("native: udt-receive1\n");
01210 
01211         const jsize capacity = env->GetArrayLength(arrayObj);
01212 
01213         if (!X_IsValidRange(env, socketID, position, limit, capacity)) {
01214                 return JNI_ERR;
01215         }
01216 
01217         const jsize size = limit - position;
01218         jbyte* data = (jbyte*) malloc(sizeof(jbyte) * size);
01219         if (data == NULL) {
01220                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_Message(env, socketID,
01221                                 "recv/recvmsg : can not allocate data array");
01222                 return JNI_ERR;
01223         }
01224 
01225         int rv;
01226 
01227         switch (socketType) {
01228         case SOCK_STREAM:
01229                 // printf("native: udt-receive1; SOCK_STREAM; socketID=%d\n", socketID);
01230                 rv = UDT::recv(socketID, (char*) data, (int) size, 0);
01231                 break;
01232         case SOCK_DGRAM:
01233                 // printf("native: udt-receive1; SOCK_DGRAM; socketID=%d\n", socketID);
01234                 rv = UDT::recvmsg(socketID, (char*) data, (int) size);
01235                 break;
01236         default:
01237                 free(data);
01238                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_Message(env, socketID,
01239                                 "recv/recvmsg : unexpected socketType");
01240                 return JNI_ERR;
01241         }
01242 
01243         if (rv > 0) { // normal
01244                 env->SetByteArrayRegion(arrayObj, position, rv, data);
01245                 free(data);
01246                 return rv;
01247         } else if (rv < 0) { // UDT::ERROR
01248                 free(data);
01249                 return UDT_ReturnReceiveError(env, socketID);
01250         } else { // ==0; UDT_TIMEOUT
01251                 free(data);
01252                 return UDT_TIMEOUT;
01253         }
01254 
01255 }
01256 
01257 // receive into direct byte buffer
01258 JNIEXPORT jint JNICALL Java_com_barchart_udt_SocketUDT_receive2(JNIEnv *env,
01259                 jobject self, const jint socketID, const jint socketType,
01260                 const jobject bufferObj, const jint position, const jint limit) {
01261 
01262         UNUSED(self);
01263 
01264         //      printf("native: udt-receive2\n");
01265 
01266         const jlong capacity = env->GetDirectBufferCapacity(bufferObj);
01267 
01268         if (!X_IsValidRange(env, socketID, position, limit, capacity)) {
01269                 return JNI_ERR;
01270         }
01271 
01272         jbyte* bufferAddress = static_cast<jbyte*> (env->GetDirectBufferAddress(
01273                         bufferObj));
01274 
01275         const jbyte* data = bufferAddress + position;
01276         const jsize size = static_cast<jsize> (limit - position);
01277 
01278         // memory boundary test
01279         // assert(data[0] | 1);
01280         // assert(data[size - 1] | 1);
01281 
01282         int rv;
01283 
01284         switch (socketType) {
01285         case SOCK_STREAM:
01286                 // printf("native: udt-receive2; SOCK_STREAM; socketID=%d\n", socketID);
01287                 rv = UDT::recv(socketID, (char*) data, (int) size, 0);
01288                 break;
01289         case SOCK_DGRAM:
01290                 // printf("native: udt-receive2; SOCK_DGRAM; socketID=%d\n", socketID);
01291                 rv = UDT::recvmsg(socketID, (char*) data, (int) size);
01292                 break;
01293         default:
01294                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_Message(env, socketID,
01295                                 "recv/recvmsg : unexpected socketType");
01296                 return JNI_ERR;
01297         }
01298 
01299         if (rv > 0) { // normal
01300                 return rv;
01301         } else if (rv < 0) { //  UDT::ERROR
01302                 return UDT_ReturnReceiveError(env, socketID);
01303         } else { // ==0; UDT_TIMEOUT
01304                 return UDT_TIMEOUT;
01305         }
01306 
01307 }
01308 
01309 /*
01310  * sendXXX call is shared for both send() and sendmsg()
01311  */
01312 
01313 // return values, if exception is NOT thrown
01314 // -1 : no buffer space (non-blocking only )
01315 // =0 : timeout expired (blocking only)
01316 // >0 : normal send, byte count
01317 
01318 jint UDT_ReturnSendError(JNIEnv *env, jint socketID) {
01319         UDT::ERRORINFO errorInfo = UDT::getlasterror();
01320         const int errorCode = errorInfo.getErrorCode();
01321         if (errorCode == CUDTException::EASYNCSND) {
01322                 // not a java exception: non-blocking mode return when no space in UDT buffer
01323         } else {
01324                 // really exception
01325                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_ErrorInfo(env, socketID, "send/sendmsg",
01326                                 &errorInfo);
01327         }
01328         return JNI_ERR;
01329 }

01331 // send from complete array
01332 JNIEXPORT jint JNICALL Java_com_barchart_udt_SocketUDT_send0(JNIEnv *env,
01333                 jobject self, const jint socketID, const jint socketType,
01334                 const jint timeToLive, const jboolean isOrdered, jbyteArray arrayObj) {
01335 
01336         // printf("native: udt-send0\n");
01337         UNUSED(self);
01338 
01339         jboolean isCopy; // whether JVM returned reference or copy
01340         jbyte *data = env->GetByteArrayElements(arrayObj, &isCopy); // note: must release
01341         const jsize size = env->GetArrayLength(arrayObj);
01342 
01343         int rv;
01344 
01345         switch (socketType) {
01346         case SOCK_STREAM:
01347                 // printf("native: udt-send0; SOCK_STREAM; socketID=%d\n", socketID);
01348                 rv = UDT::send(socketID, (char*) data, (int) size, 0);
01349                 break;
01350         case SOCK_DGRAM:
01351                 // printf("native: udt-send0; SOCK_DGRAM; socketID=%d\n", socketID);
01352                 rv = UDT::sendmsg(socketID, (char*) data, (int) size, (int) timeToLive,
01353                                 BOOL(isOrdered));
01354                 break;
01355         default:
01356                 env->ReleaseByteArrayElements(arrayObj, data, JNI_ABORT); // do not copy back
01357                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_Message(env, socketID,
01358                                 "send/sendmsg : unexpected socketType");
01359                 return JNI_ERR;
01360         }
01361 
01362         env->ReleaseByteArrayElements(arrayObj, data, JNI_ABORT); // do not copy back
01363 
01364         if (rv > 0) { // normal
01365                 return rv;
01366         } else if (rv < 0) { // UDT::ERROR
01367                 return UDT_ReturnSendError(env, socketID);
01368         } else { // ==0; UDT_TIMEOUT
01369                 return UDT_TIMEOUT;
01370         }
01371 
01372 }

01378                 jbyteArray arrayObj, const jint position, const jint limit) {

01380         // printf("native: udt-send1\n");

01384

01386                 return JNI_ERR;

01395                 return JNI_ERR;
01396         }

01399 
01400         int rv;
01401

01404                 // printf("native: udt-send1; SOCK_STREAM; socketID=%d\n", socketID);

01411                 break;

01415                                 "send/sendmsg : unexpected socketType");
01416                 return JNI_ERR;
01417         }
01418 
01419         free(data);
01420 
01421         if (rv > 0) { // normal
01422                 return rv;
01423         } else if (rv < 0) { // UDT::ERROR
01424                 return UDT_ReturnSendError(env, socketID);

01427         }

01521 JNIEXPORT void JNICALL Java_com_barchart_udt_SocketUDT_updateMonitor0(
01522                 JNIEnv *env, jobject self, jboolean makeClear) {
01523 
01524         UDT::TRACEINFO monitor;
01525 
01526         const jint socketID = UDT_GetSocketID(env, self);
01527 
01528         const int rv = UDT::perfmon(socketID, &monitor, BOOL(makeClear));
01529 
01530         if (rv == UDT::ERROR) {
01531                 UDT::ERRORINFO errorInfo = UDT::getlasterror();
01532                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_ErrorInfo(env, socketID, "updateMonitor0",
01533                                 &errorInfo);
01534                 return;
01535         }
01536 
01537         const jobject objMonitor = env->GetObjectField(self, udts_MonitorID);
01538 
01539         CHK_NUL_RET_RET(objMonitor,"objMonitor");
01540 
01541         // global measurements
01542         env->SetLongField(objMonitor, udtm_msTimeStamp, monitor.msTimeStamp); // time since the UDT entity is started, in milliseconds
01543         env->SetLongField(objMonitor, udtm_pktSentTotal, monitor.pktSentTotal); // total number of sent data packets, including retransmissions
01544         env->SetLongField(objMonitor, udtm_pktRecvTotal, monitor.pktRecvTotal); // total number of received packets
01545         env->SetIntField(objMonitor, udtm_pktSndLossTotal, monitor.pktSndLossTotal); // total number of lost packets (sender side)
01546         env->SetIntField(objMonitor, udtm_pktRcvLossTotal, monitor.pktRcvLossTotal); // total number of lost packets (receiver side)
01547         env->SetIntField(objMonitor, udtm_pktRetransTotal, monitor.pktRetransTotal); // total number of retransmitted packets
01548         env->SetIntField(objMonitor, udtm_pktSentACKTotal, monitor.pktSentACKTotal); // total number of sent ACK packets
01549         env->SetIntField(objMonitor, udtm_pktRecvACKTotal, monitor.pktRecvACKTotal); // total number of received ACK packets
01550         env->SetIntField(objMonitor, udtm_pktSentNAKTotal, monitor.pktSentNAKTotal); // total number of sent NAK packets
01551         env->SetIntField(objMonitor, udtm_pktRecvNAKTotal, monitor.pktRecvNAKTotal); // total number of received NAK packets
01552         env->SetLongField(objMonitor, udtm_usSndDurationTotal,
01553                         monitor.usSndDurationTotal); // total time duration when UDT is sending data (idle time exclusive)
01554 
01555         // local measurements
01556         env->SetLongField(objMonitor, udtm_pktSent, monitor.pktSent); // number of sent data packets, including retransmissions
01557         env->SetLongField(objMonitor, udtm_pktRecv, monitor.pktRecv); // number of received packets
01558         env->SetIntField(objMonitor, udtm_pktSndLoss, monitor.pktSndLoss); // number of lost packets (sender side)
01559         env->SetIntField(objMonitor, udtm_pktRcvLoss, monitor.pktRcvLoss); // number of lost packets (receiverer side)
01560         env->SetIntField(objMonitor, udtm_pktRetrans, monitor.pktRetrans); // number of retransmitted packets
01561         env->SetIntField(objMonitor, udtm_pktSentACK, monitor.pktSentACK); // number of sent ACK packets
01562         env->SetIntField(objMonitor, udtm_pktRecvACK, monitor.pktRecvACK); // number of received ACK packets
01563         env->SetIntField(objMonitor, udtm_pktSentNAK, monitor.pktSentNAK); // number of sent NAK packets
01564         env->SetIntField(objMonitor, udtm_pktRecvNAK, monitor.pktRecvNAK); // number of received NAK packets
01565         env->SetDoubleField(objMonitor, udtm_mbpsSendRate, monitor.mbpsSendRate); // sending rate in Mb/s
01566         env->SetDoubleField(objMonitor, udtm_mbpsRecvRate, monitor.mbpsRecvRate); // receiving rate in Mb/s
01567         env->SetLongField(objMonitor, udtm_usSndDuration, monitor.usSndDuration); // busy sending time (i.e., idle time exclusive)
01568 
01569         // instant measurements
01570         env->SetDoubleField(objMonitor, udtm_usPktSndPeriod, monitor.usPktSndPeriod); // packet sending period, in microseconds
01571         env->SetIntField(objMonitor, udtm_pktFlowWindow, monitor.pktFlowWindow); // flow window size, in number of packets
01572         env->SetIntField(objMonitor, udtm_pktCongestionWindow,
01573                         monitor.pktCongestionWindow); // congestion window size, in number of packets
01574         env->SetIntField(objMonitor, udtm_pktFlightSize, monitor.pktFlightSize); // number of packets on flight
01575         env->SetDoubleField(objMonitor, udtm_msRTT, monitor.msRTT); // RTT, in milliseconds
01576         env->SetDoubleField(objMonitor, udtm_mbpsBandwidth, monitor.mbpsBandwidth); // estimated bandwidth, in Mb/s
01577         env->SetIntField(objMonitor, udtm_byteAvailSndBuf, monitor.byteAvailSndBuf); // available UDT sender buffer size
01578         env->SetIntField(objMonitor, udtm_byteAvailRcvBuf, monitor.byteAvailRcvBuf); // available UDT receiver buffer size
01579 
01580 }
01581 
01582 // #########################################################################
01583 
01584 void UDT_CopyArrayToSet(jint* array, UDT::UDSET* udSet, const jsize size) {
01585         pair<UDT::UDSET::iterator, bool> rv;
01586         for (jint index = 0; index < size; index++) {
01587                 const jint socketID = array[index];
01588                 rv = UD_SET(socketID, udSet);
01589                 assert(rv.second == true);
01590         }
01591 }
01592 
01593 void UDT_CopySetToArray(UDT::UDSET* udSet, jint* array, const jsize size) {
01594         UDT::UDSET::iterator iterator = udSet->begin();
01595         for (jint index = 0; index < size; index++) {
01596                 const jint socketID = *iterator;
01597                 array[index] = socketID;
01598                 ++iterator;
01599         }
01600 }
01601 
01602 // sizeArray parameters
01603 #define UDT_READ_INDEX          com_barchart_udt_SocketUDT_UDT_READ_INDEX
01604 #define UDT_WRITE_INDEX         com_barchart_udt_SocketUDT_UDT_WRITE_INDEX
01605 #define UDT_EXCEPT_INDEX        com_barchart_udt_SocketUDT_UDT_EXCEPT_INDEX
01606 #define UDT_SIZE_COUNT          com_barchart_udt_SocketUDT_UDT_SIZE_COUNT
01607 
01608 // ### array-based implementation ###
01609 //
01610 // note: relies on input parameters consistency checking in java
01611 //
01612 // return value, when NOT exception
01613 // <0 : should not happen
01614 // =0 : timeout, no ready sockets
01615 // >0 : total number or reads, writes, exceptions
01616 //
01617 JNIEXPORT jint JNICALL Java_com_barchart_udt_SocketUDT_select0(JNIEnv *env,
01618                 jclass clsSocketUDT, //
01619                 const jintArray objReadArray, //
01620                 const jintArray objWriteArray, //
01621                 const jintArray objExceptArray, //
01622                 const jintArray objSizeArray, //
01623                 const jlong millisTimeout) {
01624 
01625         UNUSED(env);
01626         UNUSED(clsSocketUDT);
01627 
01628         // get interest sizes
01629         jint* sizeArray = NULL;
01630         sizeArray = (jint*) malloc(sizeof(jint) * UDT_SIZE_COUNT);
01631         if (sizeArray == NULL) {
01632                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_Message(env, 0,
01633                                 "select0 : can not allocate sizeArray");
01634                 return JNI_ERR;
01635         }
01636         env->GetIntArrayRegion(objSizeArray, 0, UDT_SIZE_COUNT, sizeArray);
01637 
01638         const jsize readSize = sizeArray[UDT_READ_INDEX];
01639         const jsize writeSize = sizeArray[UDT_WRITE_INDEX];
01640 
01641         const bool isInterestedInRead = readSize > 0;
01642         const bool isInterestedInWrite = writeSize > 0;
01643 
01644         jint* readArray = NULL;
01645         jint* writeArray = NULL;
01646 
01647         // make empty sets
01648         UDT::UDSET readSet;
01649         UDT::UDSET writeSet;
01650         UDT::UDSET exceptSet;
01651 
01652         // interested in read
01653         if (isInterestedInRead) {
01654                 //              cout << "udt-select0; readSize=" << readSize << EOL;
01655                 readArray = (jint*) malloc(sizeof(jint) * readSize);
01656                 if (readArray == NULL) {
01657                         UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_Message(env, 0,
01658                                         "select0 : can not allocate readArray");
01659                         return JNI_ERR; // XXX free ?
01660                 }
01661                 env->GetIntArrayRegion(objReadArray, 0, readSize, readArray);
01662                 UDT_CopyArrayToSet(readArray, &readSet, readSize);
01663         }
01664 
01665         // interested in write
01666         if (isInterestedInWrite) {
01667                 //              cout << "udt-select0; writeSize=" << writeSize << EOL;
01668                 writeArray = (jint*) malloc(sizeof(jint) * writeSize);
01669                 if (writeArray == NULL) {
01670                         UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_Message(env, 0,
01671                                         "select0 : can not allocate writeArray");
01672                         return JNI_ERR; // XXX free ?
01673                 }
01674                 env->GetIntArrayRegion(objWriteArray, 0, writeSize, writeArray);
01675                 UDT_CopyArrayToSet(writeArray, &writeSet, writeSize);
01676         }
01677 
01678         // convert timeout
01679         timeval timeValue;
01680         X_ConvertMillisIntoTimeValue(millisTimeout, &timeValue);
01681 
01682         // do select
01683         const int rv = UDT::select(0, &readSet, &writeSet, &exceptSet, &timeValue);
01684 
01685         // process timeout & errors
01686         if (rv <= 0) { // UDT::ERROR is '-1'; UDT_TIMEOUT is '=0';
01687                 free(sizeArray);
01688                 if (isInterestedInRead) {
01689                         free(readArray);
01690                 }
01691                 if (isInterestedInWrite) {
01692                         free(writeArray);
01693                 }
01694                 if (rv == UDT_TIMEOUT) { // timeout
01695                         return UDT_TIMEOUT;
01696                 } else {
01697                         UDT::ERRORINFO errorInfo = UDT::getlasterror();
01698                         UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_ErrorInfo(env, 0, "select0", &errorInfo);
01699                         return JNI_ERR;
01700                 }
01701         }
01702 
01703         // return read interest
01704         if (isInterestedInRead) {
01705                 const jsize readSizeReturn = readSet.size();
01706                 //              cout << "udt-select0; readSizeReturn=" << readSizeReturn << EOL;
01707                 sizeArray[UDT_READ_INDEX] = readSizeReturn;
01708                 if (readSizeReturn > 0) {
01709                         UDT_CopySetToArray(&readSet, readArray, readSizeReturn);
01710                         env->SetIntArrayRegion(objReadArray, 0, readSizeReturn, readArray);
01711                 }
01712                 free(readArray);
01713         }
01714 
01715         // return write interest
01716         if (isInterestedInWrite) {
01717                 const jsize writeSizeReturn = writeSet.size();
01718                 //              cout << "udt-select0; writeSizeReturtn=" << writeSizeReturn << EOL;
01719                 sizeArray[UDT_WRITE_INDEX] = writeSizeReturn;
01720                 if (writeSizeReturn > 0) {
01721                         UDT_CopySetToArray(&writeSet, writeArray, writeSizeReturn);
01722                         env->SetIntArrayRegion(objWriteArray, 0, writeSizeReturn,
01723                                         writeArray);
01724                 }
01725                 free(writeArray);
01726         }
01727 
01728         // exceptions report
01729         const jsize exceptSizeReturn = exceptSet.size();
01730         sizeArray[UDT_EXCEPT_INDEX] = exceptSizeReturn;
01731         if (exceptSizeReturn > 0) {
01732                 jint* exceptArray = NULL;
01733                 exceptArray = (jint*) malloc(sizeof(jint) * exceptSizeReturn);
01734                 if (exceptArray == NULL) {
01735                         UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_Message(env, 0,
01736                                         "select0 : can not allocate exceptArray");
01737                         return JNI_ERR; // XXX free ?
01738                 }
01739                 UDT_CopySetToArray(&exceptSet, exceptArray, exceptSizeReturn);
01740                 env->SetIntArrayRegion(objExceptArray, 0, exceptSizeReturn, exceptArray);
01741                 free(exceptArray);
01742         }
01743 
01744         // return sizes
01745         env->SetIntArrayRegion(objSizeArray, 0, UDT_SIZE_COUNT, sizeArray);
01746         free(sizeArray);
01747 
01748         return rv;
01749 
01750 }
01751 
01752 // ### direct-buffer-based implementation ###
01753 //
01754 // note: relies on input parameters consistency checking in java
01755 //
01756 // return value, when NOT exception
01757 // <0 : should not happen
01758 // =0 : timeout, no ready sockets
01759 // >0 : total number or reads, writes, exceptions
01760 //
01761 JNIEXPORT jint JNICALL Java_com_barchart_udt_SocketUDT_select1(JNIEnv* env,
01762                 jclass clsSocketUDT, //
01763                 const jobject objReadBuffer, //
01764                 const jobject objWriteBuffer, //
01765                 const jobject objExceptBuffer, //
01766                 const jobject objSizeBuffer, //
01767                 const jlong millisTimeout) {
01768 
01769         UNUSED(clsSocketUDT);
01770 
01771         // get interest sizes
01772         jint* sizeArray = static_cast<jint*> (env->GetDirectBufferAddress(
01773                         objSizeBuffer));
01774 
01775         const jsize readSize = sizeArray[UDT_READ_INDEX];
01776         const jsize writeSize = sizeArray[UDT_WRITE_INDEX];
01777 
01778         const bool isInterestedInRead = readSize > 0;
01779         const bool isInterestedInWrite = writeSize > 0;
01780 
01781         jint* readArray = NULL;
01782         jint* writeArray = NULL;
01783 
01784         // make empty sets
01785         UDT::UDSET readSet;
01786         UDT::UDSET writeSet;
01787         UDT::UDSET exceptSet;
01788 
01789         // interested in read
01790         if (isInterestedInRead) {
01791                 readArray = static_cast<jint*> (env->GetDirectBufferAddress(
01792                                 objReadBuffer));
01793                 UDT_CopyArrayToSet(readArray, &readSet, readSize);
01794         }
01795 
01796         // interested in write
01797         if (isInterestedInWrite) {
01798                 writeArray = static_cast<jint*> (env->GetDirectBufferAddress(
01799                                 objWriteBuffer));
01800                 UDT_CopyArrayToSet(writeArray, &writeSet, writeSize);
01801         }
01802 
01803         // convert timeout
01804         timeval timeValue;
01805         X_ConvertMillisIntoTimeValue(millisTimeout, &timeValue);
01806 
01807         // do select
01808         const int rv = UDT::select(0, &readSet, &writeSet, &exceptSet, &timeValue);
01809 
01810         // process timeout & errors
01811         if (rv <= 0) { // UDT::ERROR is '-1'; UDT_TIMEOUT is '=0';
01812                 if (rv == UDT_TIMEOUT) { // timeout
01813                         return UDT_TIMEOUT;
01814                 } else {
01815                         UDT::ERRORINFO errorInfo = UDT::getlasterror();
01816                         UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_ErrorInfo(env, 0, "select1", &errorInfo);
01817                         return JNI_ERR;
01818                 }
01819         }
01820 
01821         // return read interest
01822         if (isInterestedInRead) {
01823                 const jsize readSizeReturn = readSet.size();
01824                 assert(readSizeReturn <= readSize);
01825                 sizeArray[UDT_READ_INDEX] = readSizeReturn;
01826                 if (readSizeReturn > 0) {
01827                         UDT_CopySetToArray(&readSet, readArray, readSizeReturn);
01828                 }
01829         }
01830 
01831         // return write interest
01832         if (isInterestedInWrite) {
01833                 const jsize writeSizeReturn = writeSet.size();
01834                 sizeArray[UDT_WRITE_INDEX] = writeSizeReturn;
01835                 assert(writeSizeReturn <= writeSize);
01836                 if (writeSizeReturn > 0) {
01837                         UDT_CopySetToArray(&writeSet, writeArray, writeSizeReturn);
01838                 }
01839         }
01840 
01841         // exceptions status report
01842         const jsize exceptSizeReturn = exceptSet.size();
01843         sizeArray[UDT_EXCEPT_INDEX] = exceptSizeReturn;
01844         if (exceptSizeReturn > 0) {
01845                 jint* exceptArray = static_cast<jint*> (env->GetDirectBufferAddress(
01846                                 objExceptBuffer));
01847                 UDT_CopySetToArray(&exceptSet, exceptArray, exceptSizeReturn);
01848         }
01849 
01850         return rv;
01851 
01852 }
01853 
01854 // not used
01855 JNIEXPORT void JNICALL Java_com_barchart_udt_SocketUDT_selectEx0(JNIEnv *env,
01856                 jclass clsSocketUDT, jintArray objSelectArray, jintArray objReadArray,
01857                 jintArray objWriteArray, jintArray objExceptionArray, jlong timeout) {
01858 
01859         UNUSED(clsSocketUDT);
01860         UNUSED(objReadArray);
01861         UNUSED(objWriteArray);
01862         UNUSED(objExceptionArray);
01863 
01864         // convert timeout
01865         int64_t msTimeOut = static_cast<int64_t> (timeout);
01866 
01867         // make and populate input vector
01868 
01869         std::vector<UDTSOCKET> selectFDs;
01870 
01871         jsize selectSize = env->GetArrayLength(objSelectArray);
01872 
01873         jboolean isCopy;
01874 
01875         jint *selectArray = env->GetIntArrayElements(objSelectArray, &isCopy);
01876 
01877         for (jint index = 0; index < selectSize; index++) {
01878 
01879                 jint socketID = selectArray[index];
01880 
01881                 selectFDs.push_back(socketID);
01882 
01883         }
01884 
01885         // make empty output vectors
01886 
01887         std::vector<UDTSOCKET> readFDs;
01888         std::vector<UDTSOCKET> writeFDs;
01889         std::vector<UDTSOCKET> exceptFDs;
01890 
01891         // XXX exceptions from exceptFDs?
01892         //      int rv = UDT::selectEx(//
01893         //                      selectFDs, &readFDs, &writeFDs, &exceptFDs, msTimeOut);
01894         const int rv = UDT::selectEx(//
01895                         selectFDs, &readFDs, &writeFDs, NULL, msTimeOut);
01896 
01897         if (rv == UDT::ERROR) {
01898                 UDT::ERRORINFO errorInfo = UDT::getlasterror();
01899                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_ErrorInfo(env, 0, "selectEx0", &errorInfo);
01900                 return;
01901         }
01902 
01903         //
01904         //      cout << "udt-selectEx0; readFDs=" << readFDs.size() << EOL;
01905         //      cout << "udt-selectEx0; writeFDs=" << writeFDs.size() << EOL;
01906         //      cout << "udt-selectEx0; exceptFDs=" << exceptFDs.size() << EOL;
01907 
01908         // update selected operations
01909 
01910         for (jint index = 0; index < selectSize; index++) {
01911 
01912                 jobject objSocketUDT = NULL; // XXX
01913 
01914                 jint socketID = env->GetIntField(objSocketUDT, udts_SocketID);
01915 
01916                 std::vector<UDTSOCKET>::iterator result;
01917 
01918                 if (!readFDs.empty()) {
01919                         result = find(readFDs.begin(), readFDs.end(), socketID);
01920                         if (result != readFDs.end()) {
01921                                 env->SetBooleanField(objSocketUDT, //
01922                                                 udts_IsSelectedReadID, JNI_TRUE);
01923                         }
01924                 }
01925 
01926                 if (!writeFDs.empty()) {
01927                         result = find(writeFDs.begin(), writeFDs.end(), socketID);
01928                         if (result != writeFDs.end()) {
01929                                 env->SetBooleanField(objSocketUDT, //
01930                                                 udts_IsSelectedWriteID, JNI_TRUE);
01931                         }
01932                 }
01933 
01934                 if (!exceptFDs.empty()) {
01935                         result = find(exceptFDs.begin(), exceptFDs.end(), socketID);
01936                         if (result != exceptFDs.end()) {
01937                                 env->SetBooleanField(objSocketUDT, //
01938                                                 udts_IsSelectedExceptionID, JNI_TRUE);
01939                         }
01940                 }
01941 
01942         }
01943 
01944 }

01948                 jclass self, jobject registeredKeySet, jobject selectedKeySet,
01949                 jlong timeout) {
01950 
01951         UNUSED(self);
01952         UNUSED(selectedKeySet);
01953 
01954         // convert timeout
01955         int64_t msTimeOut = static_cast<int64_t> (timeout);
01956

01967

01969

01974                                 jdk_clsIterator_nextID);

01976                 selectFDs.push_back(socketID);
01977                 count++;
01978         }

01980         //      cout << "udt-selectEx1; count=" << count << EOL;
01981 
01982         // make empty output vectors
01983 
01984         std::vector<UDTSOCKET> readFDs;
01985         std::vector<UDTSOCKET> writeFDs;
01986         std::vector<UDTSOCKET> exceptFDs;
01987

01990                         selectFDs, &readFDs, &writeFDs, NULL, msTimeOut);

01992         // process errors
01993         if (rv == UDT::ERROR) {
01994                 UDT::ERRORINFO errorInfo = UDT::getlasterror();
01995                 UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_ErrorInfo(env, 0, "selectEx1", &errorInfo);
01996                 return;
01997         }
01998 
01999         // debug stats
02000         //      cout << "udt-selectEx1; readFDs   = " << readFDs.size() << EOL;
02001         //      cout << "udt-selectEx1; writeFDs  = " << writeFDs.size() << EOL;
02002         //      cout << "udt-selectEx1; exceptFDs = " << exceptFDs.size() << EOL;
02003 
02004         //      jobject iteratorSelected =
02005         //                      env->CallObjectMethod(selectedKeySet, iteratorID);
02006 
02007 }

02089 JNIEXPORT jint JNICALL Java_com_barchart_udt_SocketUDT_epollWait(JNIEnv *env,
02090                 jclass clsSocketUDT, //
02091                 const jint pollID, //
02092                 const jobject objReadBuffer, //
02093                 const jobject objWriteBuffer, //
02094                 const jobject objExceptBuffer, //
02095                 const jobject objSizeBuffer, //
02096                 const jlong millisTimeout) {
02097 
02098         UNUSED(clsSocketUDT);
02099 
02100         // make empty sets
02101         UDT::UDSET readSet;
02102         UDT::UDSET writeSet;
02103 
02104         // do select
02105         const int rv = UDT::epoll_wait(//
02106                         pollID, &readSet, &writeSet, millisTimeout, NULL, NULL);
02107 
02108         // process timeout & errors
02109         if (rv <= 0) { // UDT::ERROR is '-1'; UDT_TIMEOUT is '=0';
02110                 if (rv == UDT_TIMEOUT) { // timeout
02111                         return UDT_TIMEOUT;
02112                 } else {
02113                         UDT::ERRORINFO errorInfo = UDT::getlasterror();
02114                         UDT_ThrowExceptionUDT_ErrorInfo(env, 0, "epollWait", &errorInfo);
02115                         return JNI_ERR;
02116                 }
02117         }
02118 
02119         //
02120 
02121         // get interest sizes
02122         jint* sizeArray = static_cast<jint*> //
02123                         (env->GetDirectBufferAddress(objSizeBuffer));
02124 
02125         {// return read interest
02126                 const jsize readSize = readSet.size();
02127                 if (readSize > 0) {
02128                         sizeArray[UDT_READ_INDEX] = readSize;
02129                         jint* readArray = static_cast<jint*> (//
02130                                         env->GetDirectBufferAddress(objReadBuffer));
02131                         UDT_CopySetToArray(&readSet, readArray, readSize);
02132                 }
02133         }
02134 
02135         { // return write interest
02136                 const jsize writeSize = writeSet.size();
02137                 if (writeSize > 0) {
02138                         sizeArray[UDT_WRITE_INDEX] = writeSize;
02139                         jint* writeArray = static_cast<jint*> (//
02140                                         env->GetDirectBufferAddress(objWriteBuffer));
02141                         UDT_CopySetToArray(&writeSet, writeArray, writeSize);
02142                 }
02143         }
02144 
02145         { // return exceptions report TODO
02146                 UDT::UDSET exceptSet;
02147         }
02148 
02149         return rv;
02150 
02151 }

02305 JNIEXPORT void JNICALL Java_com_barchart_udt_SocketUDT_testFillArray0(
02306                 JNIEnv *env, jobject self, jbyteArray arrayObj) {
02307 
02308         // test cost of jni array fill
02309         UNUSED(self);
02310 
02311         jboolean isCopy;
02312         jbyte* array = env->GetByteArrayElements(arrayObj, &isCopy);
02313         jsize size = env->GetArrayLength(arrayObj);
02314 
02315         for (int k = 0; k < size; k++) {
02316                 array[k] = (char) k;
02317         }
02318 
02319         env->ReleaseByteArrayElements(arrayObj, array, JNI_UPDATE);
02320 
02321 }
